Weapon X wolverine from X-Men comic books based the character Dr Cornelius on the real life professor Jose Delgado of Yale University who was funded by the Pentagon during the 1960s MK ultra experiments. The lawsuit that followed which was later WON against the CIA revealed the extent of these top secret mind control experiments which were being performed on unsuspecting American citizens for decades.

Professor Jose Delgado was notorious for his cybernetic experiments on humans, prisoners mental patients children and monkeys, cats. You can find the footage of all of his experiments still online. As well as Government documents on the CIA.gov website. The documents were forcibly made public by a freedom of information act request and a lawsuit won against the CIA.

You left out a few things about Jose Delgado, Science Channel, such as the point of view he expressed here:

"The individual may think that the most important reality is his own existence, but this is only his personal point of view. This lacks historical perspective. Man does not have the right to develop his own mind. This kind of liberal orientation has great appeal. We must electronically control the brain. Someday armies and generals will be controlled by electric stimulation of the brain." 
Dr José Delgado,
Director of Neuropsychiatry
Yale University Medical School Congressional Record,
No. 26, Vol. 118 February 24, 1974

Of course, according to Delgado's reasoning itself, his reasoning should be totally dismissed even by those who would not recognize the absolute evil of his thinking and totally denounce it in the harshest terms possible for that alone, as it is merely the point of view of an individual.

What idiocy, to so blatantly contradict oneself in the very content of the comment you are making!!

Furthermore, mind control of any but those who have subjected others to it is obviously totally unjustifiable, as the victim is of the same species as is the one performing the mind control, and in fact, those who would carry out such horrors are the lowest, most wicked, vile, soulless, cruel examples of the species, and are not even rightly regarded as human.

Incredibly important discoveries were made in these experimemts. A refined understanding of the functions of different brain regions. Knowledge of how to influence the brain with electricity. Parkinson's to schizophrenia to depression all have additional, effective treatments thanks to Delgado.

And if his experiments kept these subjects from being lobotomized, I think the patients would have been thanking him.

The neurosurgical technologies that changed my life were first pioneered by a mad scientists. Ah, good to know. lol In all seriousness though, this crap was really groundbreaking for its day, and sadly is even now... Although the ethics of it back then were horribly applied.I have to wonder though if the ethical breaches are part of what scared medical science off the idea for so long. Because they really had a good one.  It took until the 80s for the use to be revived, by neurologists in France, and now in 2015 people like me are still struggling to find doctors and institutions willing to use this (apparently very old) idea in the treatment of  debilitating neurological and neuropsychiatric disorders.

Given that it is confirmed in this episode that total mind control exists, why has there not been any demand for full disclosure on the matter by the United States government, given that it seems as though they just might possibly have taken an interest in this technology?

What, is it simply too outlandish for people to imagine that the government be concerned with controlling that which allows one to control people from the inside out for some reason or another?

It was claimed or at least quoted from other source by Milton William Cooper that the CIA became involved with Delgado's experiments.
